ygData.subject: Re: Guild- Qui H'oom Dai website-Singapore
ygData.msgSnippet: LKW, need my Super-magical-extrememly-well-balance-rune-glowing-bone-flowing-flying-shiny-remote-controlled parang? Damage: 999 Delay: 1 Anyone can use.
ygData.messageBody:
LKW, need my
"Super-magical-extrememly-well-balance-rune-glowing-bone-flowing-flying-shiny-remote-controlled"
parang?

Damage: 999
Delay: 1
Anyone can use. Randomly cast all the evocation spells in the game at once

Selling 3 plat for 1. 5 plat for 2. Get them while they're hot!

Alex wrote:

> From: "Alex" <leealex@...>
>
> LOL, hahhaha
>
> i wear LJ, parang no use :P
>
> yiyang fallen feign death..again
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: LKW <leekw13@...>
> To: <sg-everquest@onelist.com>
> Date: Thursday, June 24, 1999 6:06 PM
> Subject: Re: [sg-everquest] Guild- Qui H'oom Dai website-Singapore
>
> >From: LKW <leekw13@...>
> >
> >Command simi member? I never command my members in UO after been a GM for
> >more than 1.5 yrs leh. The only things I can relate to 'commanding' in EQ
> >is the lower lvl kakis 'command' the higher lvl kakis to tank, hehehehe,
> >see below:
> >
> >"Ooi, Yiyang, go tank leh"
> >You see Yiyang fallen death.
> >^%$#^%$)*@ ask you tank you go act dead...ahhhhh...someone tank this thug
> >for meeeeeeee...!"
> >Zilus was slained by Thug.
> >^%$#^%$)*@
> >
> >You see Ziltus waiting outside Yiyang's house with a parang the next
> >morning. LOL (j/k)
> >
> >
> >
> >On Thursday, June 24, 1999 5:55 PM, Gary Qui Hong Loong
> >[SMTP:kanglun@...] wrote:
> >> From: Gary Qui Hong Loong <kanglun@...>
> >>
> >> I'm alreadi an Officer. heheh but don't know what is the command to
> >recruit
> >> ppl. any1 can tell me how? heheh
> >>
> >> Alex wrote:
> >>
> >> > From: "Alex" <leealex@...>
> >> >
> >> > Sereph have an excellent idea there.
> >> > Having an Officer will co-ordinate events and some PR stuff for us
> >> > Singaporean.
> >> > This will benefit not only us but the whole guild too.
> >> > I however do not see a need to have a "spliting" of the guild. Maybe i
> >> > understand diffrently. forgive me.
> >> > With the exiting structure in Qui H'oom Dai, we only need to contribute
> >and
> >> > enchance it and not to "split" it to a Singapore typo.
> >> > A "international" guild is much more attractive.
> >> > With our diverse skills and resourses, im confident that we can help on
> >the
> >> > web pages, special events, etc.
> >> > Now, we have another "loban" in Singularity.Thx to Sereph again.
> >> >
> >> > Concerning Officer, Im proposing the following ppl to be in:
> >> > Sereph, Garren and Entreri .
> >> > why? this ppl has the "fire", web knowhow and connections and most
> >important
> >> > of all....THEY play the game day and Nite! (get a life man :P )
> >..j/l\k
> >> > Being avaiable is important , an officer need to be acessable.(and of
> >> > course, we need to blame and hang someone when thing go wrong, they
> >should
> >> > be good bait for luring the Griffin too)
> >> > wheather we have one officer or three, we leave that to the guild
> >leaders
> >> >
> >> > Please lets have some further inputs on this , suggestions and ideas
> >pls.
> >> >
> >> > -----Original Message-----
> >> > From: Sereph <garford@...>
> >> > To: <sg-everquest@onelist.com>
> >> > Date: Wednesday, June 23, 1999 1:18 AM
> >> > Subject: Re: [sg-everquest] Guild- Qui H'oom Dai website
> >> >
> >> > >From: Sereph <garford@...>
> >> > >
> >> > >I've got a proposition, mind asking the guild to set aside a seperate
> >> > division
> >> > >for us and appointing one of you guys who join earlier as an official?
> >> > >
> >> > >I ask this because if we all join in, the S'porean porpulation in
> >there
> >> > will
> >> > >be quite huge and will grow furthur in the future. Spliting the guild
> >into
> >> > 2
> >> > >can aid in co-ordinating events easier since we have this list in
> >addition
> >> > to
> >> > >whatever form of communication they used and will make grouping easier
> >too
> >> > >
> >> > >If this work out, I stop yakking the fact that WE NEED A CLERIC!!!
> >> > >
> >> > >Alex wrote:
> >> > >
> >> > >> From: "Alex" <leealex@...>
